Description: Rim and neck sherd of Laconian black-glazed pottery krater; interior glazed black; exterior: glazed black on top of flat rim; slipped white on outside of rim with decoration consisting of broken maeander pattern between rows of dots; neck glazed.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1924,1201.39. The sherd belongs in Stibbe's Group E, the group of kraters with geometric rim ornaments only (Stibbe, 1989, 33).
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p.562, no. E 44)
Stibbe 1989 / Laconian Mixing Bowls. A history of the Krater Lakonikos from the 7th to the 5th century BC (p. 103)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GC.41) (phase 3)
